fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When upgrade from Bamboo 6.5.x or older to Bamboo 6.6.x or later, it fail with "Group already exists in the Remote Directory" when there is a LDAP user that is assigned with a local group membership and the same membership exist in LDAP server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Bamboo 6.5.x
# Create a user "test" in LDAP server
# Configure LDAP repository
# From Bamboo Administration, edit the LDAP user "test" to assign it to the local Bamboo group "bamboo-admin"
# Create a group "bamboo-admin" in LDAP server
# Assign LDAP user to the group "bamboo-admin" in LDAP server
No error in Bamboo
# Upgrade Bamboo to version 6.6.x

h3. Expected Results
Upgrade is successful

h3. Actual Results
Upgrade fail with the below exception is thrown in the atlassian-bamboo.log file:
{noformat}
2019-06-21 18:18:09,977 INFO [17-UpgradeTaskBackgroundThread:pool-31-thread-1] [AbstractUpgradeManager] 60602 : Move users to Embedded Crowd (post-bootstrap)
2019-06-21 18:18:09,977 INFO [17-UpgradeTaskBackgroundThread:pool-31-thread-1] [AbstractUpgradeManager] -----------------------------------------------------
2019-06-21 18:18:10,152 INFO [17-UpgradeTaskBackgroundThread:pool-31-thread-1] [AtlassianUserDataMigrator] Copying 2 groups...
2019-06-21 18:18:10,170 INFO [17-UpgradeTaskBackgroundThread:pool-31-thread-1] [UpgradeTask60602MoveUsersToEmbeddedCrowd] Migration of groups took 118.7 ms
2019-06-21 18:18:10,170 INFO [17-UpgradeTaskBackgroundThread:pool-31-thread-1] [AtlassianUserDataMigrator] Copying 2 users...
2019-06-21 18:18:10,193 INFO [17-UpgradeTaskBackgroundThread:pool-31-thread-1] [UpgradeTask60602MoveUsersToEmbeddedCrowd] Migration of users took 23.45 ms
2019-06-21 18:18:10,196 INFO [17-UpgradeTaskBackgroundThread:pool-31-thread-1] [AtlassianUserDataMigrator] Upgrading external membership information using data from the database
2019-06-21 18:18:10,197 INFO [17-UpgradeTaskBackgroundThread:pool-31-thread-1] [AtlassianUserDataMigrator] Copying 1 local memberships of LDAP users...
2019-06-21 18:18:10,445 WARN [17-UpgradeTaskBackgroundThread:pool-31-thread-1] [AtlassianUserDataMigrator] User not found in local repository. It might be available at external repository, creating user placeholder to be filled by Crowd on LDAP synchronization. User name: [test], group name: [bamboo-admin]
2019-06-21 18:18:10,569 ERROR [17-UpgradeTaskBackgroundThread:pool-31-thread-1] [AbstractUpgradeManager] com.atlassian.crowd.exception.runtime.OperationFailedException: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.InvalidGroupException: Group already exists in the Remote Directory
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.runtime.OperationFailedException: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.InvalidGroupException: Group already exists in the Remote Directory
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.CrowdServiceImpl.addUserToGroup(CrowdServiceImpl.java:557)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.upgrade.tasks.v6_6.ec.AtlassianUserDataMigrator.migrateMembershipInLocalGroup(AtlassianUserDataMigrator.java:389)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.upgrade.tasks.v6_6.ec.AtlassianUserDataMigrator.access$400(AtlassianUserDataMigrator.java:71)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.upgrade.tasks.v6_6.ec.AtlassianUserDataMigrator$4.processRowInternal(AtlassianUserDataMigrator.java:359)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.upgrade.tasks.v6_6.ec.SessionClearingRowCallbackHandler.processRow(SessionClearingRowCallbackHandler.java:36)
	at org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcTemplate$RowCallbackHandlerResultSetExtractor.extractData(JdbcTemplate.java:1566)
{noformat}

h3. Notes
Even though there is duplicate membership setting, Bamboo should skip the migration for duplicate membership instead of failing the upgrade

h3. Workaround
# Check the membership data in database:
{code:sql}
SELECT em.EXTENTITYID, ee.NAME, em.GROUPID, g.GROUPNAME
FROM EXTERNAL_MEMBERS em
JOIN EXTERNAL_ENTITIES ee ON em.EXTENTITYID=ee.ID
JOIN GROUPS g ON em.GROUPID=g.ID;
{code}
# Compare it with LDAP server
# If there is any duplicate membership with LDAP server, delete it in the table EXTERNAL_MEMBERS
{code:sql}
DELETE FROM EXTERNAL_MEMBERS 
WHERE EXTENTITYID=<userID>
AND GROUPID=<groupID>;
{code}
fields.summary: Upgrade fail with Group already exists in the Remote Directory

fields.description:
Each time a deployment project is created, all Bamboo users are unconditionally granted VIEW permission to the new entity. There is no way to opt out of this behaviour. The only workaround is to change permissions after the deployment project is created (after it had been visible to everyone for some time).

When creating plans and projects, on the other hand, there's a checkbox present which allows to control this behaviour. When enabled, all users will be granted the VIEW permissions. When disabled, no users apart from the creator will have any permissions. By default the checkbox is not set, making it an opt-in setting to make the new plan/project public.

Similar checkbox should be added for deployment project creation wizard, to allow creation of deployment project without having to worry about compromising potentially sensitive information.
fields.summary: Opt-in setting to grant VIEW permission to all users when creating a deployment project

fields.description:
When artifacts are consumed by e.g. JFrog Artifactory and so Bamboo's built-in shared artifacts functionality is not utilized, Bamboo exhibits the following message "No shared artifacts found for related plan. Please configure the build plan to publish shared artifacts".

Currently there is no option to suppress it. This message may cause Bamboo user confusion.

Possible workaround is to provide e.g. a dummy artifact to Bamboo.
fields.summary: Suppress warning when not using Bamboo's shared artifacts functionality

h3. Issue Summary

h4. Steps to Reproduce

 # Create a test that fails
 # Quarantine the failed test

A plan branch should be created in Bamboo and build triggered.
All plans that have automatic branch detection on and use the repository should have the branch created.

Currently, [Atlassian AWS Templates|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-aws-deployment/src/master/templates/] does not have a Bamboo template

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Junit parser parses a result, if the values of the name property of a testcase of the same classname are equal, it outputs only a single test case of that class.
h3. Notes

The parser, should parse all testcases regardless of the name property value being thesame or not
h3. Workaround

Manually change the name property value of each testcase
fields.summary: Junit not parsing correctly

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Users require Deployment Project Edit permissions to clone Deployment Environments. This is a difference in user experience from Builds where a user with Clone permission can clone builds without being able to edit builds that they don't own.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a similar Clone privilege to Deployment Environments

h3. Why this is important
* This would more closely align Build and Deployment functionality
* This allows admins to create a template environment that users can clone

h3. Workaround 
If users are not able to have Project edit privileges, admins can create environments. If users can have Project edit privileges, grant them edit privileges on the Project to create or clone deployments.
fields.summary: Allow users to clone Deployment projects without Project Edit permission

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Recently built result links on the Build Activity dashboard use the Base URL for linking

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access Bamboo via http://localhost:8085
# Change the Base URL at *Bamboo Administration >> General Configuration* to something else
# Observe that the link for *Recently built* results match the Base URL as opposed to the URL in the browser

h3. Expected Results
Links via the UI should use the browser address.

h3. Actual Results
It uses the Base URL.

h3. Workaround
Change the Base URL to the desired address.
fields.summary: Recently built result links on the Build Activity dashboard use the Base URL for linking

fields.description:
h3. Users have no way of knowing a plugin is incompatible with a Bamboo version.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # From Bamboo administrative page, click *Find new apps*
 # Use the search text field to search for eg. Rest API
 # It returns a page of apps
 !Screenshot from 2019-06-03 13-50-16.png|width=483,height=281!
 # Click the install button

h3. Expected Results

The installation modal pops up
h3. Actual Results

The Install button is not responsive from a users perspective. But in the browser developers console, an HTTP response code of 404 is seen.

*(Optional)*

The install button or some message should show the app is incompatible with the Bamboo version.
h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Unable to know plugin is incompactible

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When rerunning an old build with specs, Bamboo will not restore the specs configuration that was used when the build was run for the first time. This will not take the specs advantage to save the old configurations and rerun the old build with the same settings.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a plan with specs
 # Run a build
 # Change the specs configuration (e.g. add an extra task with something)
 # Rerun the first build and notice that the new configuration is used, not the old one.

h3. Suggested solution

The build will run with the old configuration
h3. Workaround

You can reestablish the old configuration by deploying it again to the server. The steps would be:
 # In the terminal check out the specs repository in the revision that represents the configuration you want.
 # Redeploy the configuration from your terminal using the command below:
{code}mvn -Ppublish-specs{code}

Keep in mind that you will need to redo the steps above to set back the build configuration to the latest one again. It will allow new builds to run with the right configuration.
fields.summary: Bamboo should run old builds with matching old plan specs configuration

fields.description:

Allow Deployment Environment permissions to be set or modified at the Deployment Project level
h3. Suggested Solution

h4. Why this is important 
If permission must be changed to deployment environments within a project, the permission must be changed to each environment individually. 

h3. Workaround 
(Optional)
fields.summary: Deployment Project Permission Inheritance

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Bamboo is configured to use an outbound HTTP(S) proxy, whenever a Bitbucket Server-type repository is being added or edited in Bamboo, Bamboo is unable to obtain a list of Bitbucket Server mirrors, thus forcing the user to choose the primary mirror.
h3. Environment

Bamboo with outbound HTTP or HTTPS proxy, Bitbucket Server with Smart Mirrors.
[https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/how-to-configure-outbound-http-and-https-proxy-for-your-atlassian-application-834000120.html]
[https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/smart-mirroring-776640046.html]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create or edit a Bitbucket Server repository
 # Go to advanced options
 # Try to select a Bitbucket Server mirror

h3. Expected Results

The mirror is available and can be selected.
h3. Actual Results

No mirrors are available, except for the primary server.

The below is logged if log level DEBUG is set for package com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.stash:
{noformat}
[BitbucketSeverMirrorClient] Error connecting to mirror: <mirrorName>
[BitbucketSeverMirrorClient] java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
{noformat}
h3. Notes

Without the outbound proxy, system behaves as expected.

h3. Workaround

Use primary BbS server or disable outbound HTTP(S) proxy.
fields.summary: Bamboo doesn't see Bitbucket Server mirrors when using outbound HTTP(S) proxy

fields.description: Bamboo Specs YAML could have a task for SSH Tasks
fields.summary: Include SSH Task in Bamboo Specs YAML

fields.description:
Currently, there is a feature to limit branch creation with regex expression.

 

It will be good to have the same feature for pull requests as well

*When pull request is created and matches expression*
fields.summary: To limit creation of branch plan for pull requests belonging to certain branches

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Bamboo doesn't mark the option "Clean working directory after each build" in *Job Configuration > Miscellaneous* tab by default when creating a new job.
h3. Suggested Solution

Bamboo should have an option that allows configuring the projects do mark the option "Clean working directory after each build" when creating new jobs by default.
fields.summary: Allow to configure project to mark by default the option "Clean working directory after each build"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If the user has permissions enough to create new plans, he can attach volumes to Docker runner containers without any restriction.
This raises a security concern since if Docker is running as root, a folder with sensitive data inside the host machine can be mounted on this container and the files will/can be manipulated with root permissions.
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be a good idea if only Bamboo admins could specify the volumes that can be attached to the Docker Runner container.
fields.summary: Restrict the ability of mounting volumes in a Docker Runner container only to admins

fields.description:
To be able to support all kind of tools it would be convenient if the Build Warning Parser would allow a custom regex to capture the information.

This is quite common to support, for example VSCode and Qt Creator has options like this to integrate well with custom tools.

This is for example how it looks in Qt Creator:

!image-2019-06-08-18-53-31-421.png!

Something similar could be integrate into the build warning parser task.

A regex together with capture positions for the different data.
fields.summary: Allow custom regex in Build Warning Parser

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Bamboo doesn't have the possibility to add capabilities to Elastic Agents using *bamboo-capabilities.properties* file.

If the customer wants to migrate the Remote Agents to Elastic Agents using the *bamboo-capabilities.properties* it is necessary to follow this KB: [Configuring elastic agent capabilities|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/configuring-elastic-agent-capabilities-289277140.html].
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be great if it's possible to add capabilities to Elastic Agents using *bamboo-capabilities.properties* file.
fields.summary: Allow to add capabilities to Elastic Agents using bamboo-capabilities.properties file

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After upgrading Bamboo to version 6.9.1, accessing the All Deployment Projects page will have a popup window with NullPointerException stack trace

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Bamboo version 6.4.1
# Create Application Link with Bitbucket Server
# Use Bamboo Specs RSS to create deployment project environment in Bamboo
# Upgrade Bamboo to version 6.9.1
No error during upgrade
# Access the All Deployment Projects page

h3. Expected Results
There won't be any error

h3. Actual Results
No deployment and environment listed in the page.
There is a popup window with NullPointerException stack trace and the below exception is thrown in the atlassian-bamboo.log file:
{noformat}
2019-06-02 16:39:06,325 WARN [http-nio-80-exec-20] [BambooRuntimeExceptionMapper] Unexpected error from REST call
java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.atlassian.bamboo.utils.DurationUtils.getRelativeDate(DurationUtils.java:115)
at com.atlassian.bamboo.utils.DurationUtils.getRelativeDate(DurationUtils.java:103)
at com.atlassian.bamboo.rest.model.repository.RestVcsLocationBambooSpecsState.<init>(RestVcsLocationBambooSpecsState.java:42)
at com.atlassian.bamboo.rest.model.repository.RestVcsBambooSpecsSource.<init>(RestVcsBambooSpecsSource.java:25)
at com.atlassian.bamboo.rest.model.deployments.projects.RestDeploymentProject.<init>(RestDeploymentProject.java:70)
at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.rest.deployments.projects.DeploymentDashboardResource.lambda$getDeploymentProjects$0(DeploymentDashboardResource.java:116)
at java.util.LinkedHashMap.forEach(LinkedHashMap.java:684)
at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.rest.deployments.projects.DeploymentDashboardResource.getDeploymentProjects(DeploymentDashboardResource.java:111)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)

{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
* Bamboo Specs data is stored without SPECS_EXECUTION_DATE previously. After upgrade, the new column is created with NULL data
* Due to this NULL data, Specs Status in the repository does not show this previous Specs build too

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Accessing All Deployment Projects page have NullPointerException

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating/changing a Environment trigger to disabled using the {{.enabled(false)}} function, the UI displays the trigger as disabled but the trigger still fires. 

h3. Environment
 * Deployment with Bamboo Specs.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Deployment plan with a disabled trigger
# Export it to a Specs project
# Remove or enable the trigger in the UI
# Run the Specs to update the trigger to be disabled

h3. Expected Results
The trigger is disabled

h3. Actual Results
The trigger appears to be disabled in the UI however it still fires as if it was enabled.

h3. Workaround
# Navigate to the trigger settings in the UI 
# Make sure "Disable this trigger" is checked
# Click "Save trigger"
fields.summary: Setting a Deployment Environment trigger as disabled with Bamboo Specs does not disable the trigger

fields.description:
When accessing artifacts there is no good way to go back to the top level of the build that holds the artifacts.  The "Back" button is adequate for simple artifacts but this is compounded annoying when the artifact has a folder hierarchy and the navigation desired is to move up in that hierarchy.

 

An image illustrates the point.   Below is a artifact download page from an artifact containing multiple files with hierarchy.  The navigation "down to" a specific file is easy enough but nothing on this page tells you key information like:
 * The plan name
 * The build number
 * The location in the hierarchy (other than in the file path which is only visible here because these are stored in an S3 bucket ...)

Additionally, if one wishes to download *all* the files in an artifact, it would really be nice to have that option in "one click" to generate a ZIP and download them in a single operation.

 

!image-2019-06-06-10-31-54-496.png!
fields.summary: Artifact download could use some navigation improvement.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Artifacts produced on Windows build agents use the backslash character ( \ ) in the file names if the files are part of a hierarchy and thus this information is not preserved.
 Object key naming conventions for S3 objects ([https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/UsingMetadata.html]) recommend using the forward slash ( / ) character to preserve hierarchy information.
 Currently Bamboo does not conform to the guidelines for naming.
h3. Environment
 * Windows remote agents

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable the S3 artifact handler in Bamboo.
 # Run a plan that produces an artifact that is made of subdirectories and files (for example dir1\dir2\file.txt)
 # Use the produced artifact in another plan that runs on a Linux remote agent.
 # The artifact will be a file (for example dir1\dir2\file.txt) instead of a hierarchy.

h3. Expected Results

The hierarchy information of the artifact is preserved in the file name using the forward slash.
h3. Actual Results

The artifact is a file (for example dir1\dir2\file.txt) that uses a non-recommended character to represent hierarchical information. 
h3. Workaround

Perform an additional step (with a script task) that archives the files produced by the build that are hierarchical. Define the resulting archive as the build artifact such that a single file is uploaded to the S3 bucket.
When using the artifact perform an extract step to recover the original hierarchy of the files.
fields.summary: Adopt the object key naming guidelines for S3 buckets

fields.description:
When using the build warning parser together with Bitbucket it is important that the filename in the warning message is a relative path from the root of the repo otherwise Bitbucket will not be able to place the warning in-line in the code of a Pull Request. In many cases the filename in the warning message is instead an absolute path, or a relative path from the build folder.

Example:

 
{code:java}
{ 
  "repositoryId":1,
  "fileName":"C:/Builds/bamboo-build/xyz/src/source.c",
  "lineNumber":9,
  "message":"unreferenced formal parameter",
  "severity":"NORMAL",
  "category":"C4100",
  "source":"MSBuild"
}
{code}
In this case "C:/Builds/bamboo-build/xyz/" needs to be removed from the "fileName".

This could be achieved by adding an extra option to the Build Warning Parser task where the user can enter one or more strings that should be removed from the beginning of the fileName.
fields.summary: Allow build warning parser to remove common prefix in filename

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Repository-Stored Specs (RSS) can only be scanned from the "root" (or primary) branch of the linked repository. Defaults here include {{master}} (Git), {{default}} (Hg), or {{trunk}} (SVN). 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow RSS to be scanned from branches as well as the primary.

h3. Why this is important
Some teams may store Bamboo Specs centrally, but have data that cannot be shared between teams. With the current functionality, the data would have to be shared, but with branches, each sub-organization can manage Specs on their own branch.

h3. Workaround 
One possible workaround may be to add one Linked repository per branch with specs definitions.
fields.summary: Allow Repository-Stored Specs to be scanned from branches

h2. Update (16/04/2020)

(!) Please follow BAM-20900 for additional information

h3. Problem

Because of Bitbucket cloud rest api change [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/bitbucket/bitbucket-api-changes-gdpr/]
 I cannot
 * create and update via UI
 * upload via specs

Bitbucket cloud private and public repositories if user is an owner, for teams it works.

The UI displays the following errors when performing "Test Connection":
 * Invalid Username
 * We couldn't connect to the repository. The details you provided were invalid.

*Note*: This affects all versions before 6.9.1, 6.8.3

Define repository as a Git or Mercurial repository

Limitations of workaround:
 * Build status integration with Bitbucket Cloud isn't supported by the Git type repository
 * Create plan branch when pull request is created (automatic pull request detection) isn't supported.
 * Lack of easy-to-use drop downs for branch and repository selection when configuring a repository.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Bamboo plan cache operations can deadlock when connection pool is smaller than max http threads. Once the deadlock is triggered, the application is unresponsive until restarted. The default Bamboo configuration is:
* 150 max threads
* 100 max database connections

h3. Steps to Reproduce
{panel}
Use postgresql to reproduce -- easier to lock a table to line everything up for a deadlock

Reduce limits for easier reproduction:
* Set {{maxThreads}} to {{30}} in {{$BAMBOO_INSTALL/conf/server.xml}}
* Set {{max_size}} of connection pool to {{20}} in {{$BAMBOO_HOME/bamboo.cfg.xml}}

Create about 400 plans via Bamboo Specs for a longer plan cache invalidation
{panel}

# *Bulk action >> Add notification*
# Choose all plans, hit next but don't confirm yet.
# Prepare the below SQL query to run to lock a table but don't run it yet
{code}
@set autocommit off;
LOCK TABLE BUILD IN ACCESS EXCLUSIVE MODE;
SELECT count(BUILD_ID) FROM BUILD;
{code}
# Tail Bamboo logs to confirm when plan cache is being invalidated.
# Fire off the bulk action.
# Check logs, if plan cache is being invalidated -- execute the SQL to lock the build table. This allows us to then fire off a bunch of HTTP threads that need to access the cache before invalidation finishes.
# Run the below example script to tie up HTTP threads on plan dashboard
{code}
BAMBOO_BASE_URL=http://localhost:8085/
BAMBOO_USER=bamboo
BAMBOO_PASSWORD=bamboo

for i in {1..40}
do 
  sem -j 40 curl -u $BAMBOO_USER:$BAMBOO_PASSWORD -X GET $BAMBOO_BASE_URL/allPlans.action
done
{code}
# Wait for all 30 HTTP threads to be used: {{tail -f catalina.out | grep "http-nio-8085-exec"}} or grab a thread dump.
# Unlock the table
{code}
commit transaction;
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Everything unblocks and continues.

h3. Actual Results
Application deadlocks and needs to be restarted"
* No threads are in JDBC. No transactions or C3P0 helpers are trying to get a connection.
* All threads are waiting to enter the plan cache but the thread they're waiting on is waiting for a pooled connection.
* This thread can't get a pooled connection because all the threads waiting to enter the plan cache are holding one.

Example blocked thread holding a pooled connection (if there are as many of these as there are pooled connections, a deadlock can occur)
{noformat}
"http-nio-8085-exec-123" #328 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f74fd90b800 nid=0x6542 waiting on condition [0x00007f747b821000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x00000000eec5ced0> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock$NonfairSync)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.parkAndCheckInterrupt(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:836)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquireQueued(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:870)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquire(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:1199)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock$NonfairSync.lock(ReentrantLock.java:209)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock.lock(ReentrantLock.java:285)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.utils.collections.AlwaysInvalidatingCacheDecorator.get(AlwaysInvalidatingCacheDecorator.java:57)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.utils.collections.AlwaysInvalidatingCacheDecorator.getUnchecked(AlwaysInvalidatingCacheDecorator.java:126)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.cache.ImmutablePlanCacheServiceImpl.internalGetPlanByKey(ImmutablePlanCacheServiceImpl.java:487)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.cache.ImmutablePlanCacheServiceImpl.lambda$internalGetAllChainsStream$11(ImmutablePlanCacheServiceImpl.java:571)
{noformat}

Thread holding the lock is waiting for a pooled connection:
{noformat}
   Locked ownable synchronizers:
	- <0x00000000eec5ced0> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock$NonfairSync)
...
"http-nio-8085-exec-1" #175 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f752c0e0000 nid=0x411f in Object.wait() [0x00007f7484991000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (on object monitor)
	at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)
	at com.mchange.v2.resourcepool.BasicResourcePool.awaitAvailable(BasicResourcePool.java:1465)
	at com.mchange.v2.resourcepool.BasicResourcePool.prelimCheckoutResource(BasicResourcePool.java:644)
	- locked <0x00000000c27db328> (a com.mchange.v2.resourcepool.BasicResourcePool)
	at com.mchange.v2.resourcepool.BasicResourcePool.checkoutResource(BasicResourcePool.java:554)
	at com.mchange.v2.c3p0.impl.C3P0PooledConnectionPool.checkoutAndMarkConnectionInUse(C3P0PooledConnectionPool.java:758)
	at com.mchange.v2.c3p0.impl.C3P0PooledConnectionPool.checkoutPooledConnection(C3P0PooledConnectionPool.java:685)
	at com.mchange.v2.c3p0.impl.AbstractPoolBackedDataSource.getConnection(AbstractPoolBackedDataSource.java:140)
	at org.hibernate.c3p0.internal.C3P0ConnectionProvider.getConnection(C3P0ConnectionProvider.java:72)
	at org.hibernate.internal.NonContextualJdbcConnectionAccess.obtainConnection(NonContextualJdbcConnectionAccess.java:35)
	at org.hibernate.resource.jdbc.internal.LogicalConnectionManagedImpl.acquireConnectionIfNeeded(LogicalConnectionManagedImpl.java:106)
	at org.hibernate.resource.jdbc.internal.LogicalConnectionManagedImpl.getPhysicalConnection(LogicalConnectionManagedImpl.java:136)
	at org.hibernate.internal.SessionImpl.connection(SessionImpl.java:541)
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate5.HibernateTransactionManager.doBegin(HibernateTransactionManager.java:470)
	at org.springframework.transaction.support.AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.handleExistingTransaction(AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.java:430)
	at org.springframework.transaction.support.AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.getTransaction(AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.java:354)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor201.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:343)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:206)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy109.getTransaction(Unknown Source)
	at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionTemplate.execute(TransactionTemplate.java:137)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.cache.CacheLoadContextSupport.load(CacheLoadContextSupport.java:74)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.cache.ImmutablePlanCacheServiceImpl$1.lambda$load$1(ImmutablePlanCacheServiceImpl.java:125)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.cache.ImmutablePlanCacheServiceImpl$1$$Lambda$397/1882222604.call(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.executor.RetryingTaskExecutor.rerun(RetryingTaskExecutor.java:112)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.executor.RetryingTaskExecutor.runTask(RetryingTaskExecutor.java:99)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.executor.RetryingTaskExecutor.retry(RetryingTaskExecutor.java:207)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.cache.ImmutablePlanCacheServiceImpl$1.load(ImmutablePlanCacheServiceImpl.java:129)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.cache.ImmutablePlanCacheServiceImpl$1.load(ImmutablePlanCacheServiceImpl.java:103)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$LoadingValueReference.loadFuture(LocalCache.java:3527)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.loadSync(LocalCache.java:2319)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.lockedGetOrLoad(LocalCache.java:2282)
	- locked <0x00000000eec5cfe0> (a com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$StrongEntry)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.get(LocalCache.java:2197)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache.get(LocalCache.java:3937)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache.getOrLoad(LocalCache.java:3941)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$LocalLoadingCache.get(LocalCache.java:4824)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.utils.collections.AlwaysInvalidatingCacheDecorator.get(AlwaysInvalidatingCacheDecorator.java:65)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.utils.collections.AlwaysInvalidatingCacheDecorator.getUnchecked(AlwaysInvalidatingCacheDecorator.java:126)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.cache.ImmutablePlanCacheServiceImpl.internalGetPlanByKey(ImmutablePlanCacheServiceImpl.java:487)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.cache.ImmutablePlanCacheServiceImpl.lambda$internalGetAllChainsStream$11(ImmutablePlanCacheServiceImpl.java:571)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.cache.ImmutablePlanCacheServiceImpl$$Lambda$455/516208531.apply(Unknown Source)
{noformat}

h3. Notes
* [BAM\-20323: Whole Plan cache invalidated when user rename event occurs. (fixed in Bamboo 6.8.1, 6.9.0)|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-20323] can increase the window for hitting the deadlock when LDAP syncs.


h3. Workaround
Ensure that *hibernate.c3p0.max_size* in {{$BAMBOO_HOME/bamboo.cfg.xml}} is higher than {{maxThreads}} on HTTP connector in {{$BAMBOO_INSTALL/conf/server.xml}} by about 30 (overhead for background threads).

Your database must also be configured to handle the number of connections set for *hibernate.c3p0.max_size*.
fields.summary: Bamboo plan cache operations can deadlock when connection pool is smaller than max http threads

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

API Documentation for the elasticConfiguration REST APIs are not well documented.

{{/elasticConfiguration}}, {{/elasticConfiguration/{configurationId}}}, and {{/elasticConfiguration/image-id/\{imageId}?newImageId}} does not include an acceptable request representation or parameters so it's difficult to know which parameters need to be included. Example:
 * [https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-bamboo/REST/6.8.1/#d2e2681]

h3. Suggested Solution

Update the documentation to include correct response examples.

Example, for GET {{/elasticConfiguration}}
{code:java}
{
        "configurationId": 262146,
        "configurationName": "Windows stock image",
        "configurationDescription": "Elastic Image Configuration shipped with Bamboo",
        "imageId": "ami-0137c5d951e6fd8d6",
        "ebsEnabled": false,
        "useLegacyEbsHandling": false,
        "instanceType": "M3Large",
        "product": "Windows",
        "startupScripts": [],
        "architecture": "x86_64",
        "platform": "windows",
        "rootDeviceType": "ebs",
        "region": "eu-c1",
        "imageFilesVersion": "3.0",
        "isEbsOptimised": false
    },
{code}
Example response for PUT {{/elasticConfiguration/image-id/\{imageId}?newImageId}}
{code:java}
2
{code}
_(where the number represents the amount of configurations that have changed)_
h3. Workaround

For a better idea on how to use these APIs, see the PUT {{/elasticConfiguration/image-id/\{imageId}?newImageId}} {{curl}} example included below:
{code:java}
curl --user bamboo-admin:password -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X PUT http://bamboo:8085/rest/api/latest/elasticConfiguration/image-id/ami-xxxxxxxx?newImageId=ami-xxxxxxxx
{code}
fields.summary: REST API documentation for elasticConfiguration needs improvement

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Bamboo always shows in the branches dropdown button the branch that is configured in the repository settings in the Plan > Repositories tab. An example is listed below:
 # *Branches dropdown button:*
 !image-2019-05-24-12-33-57-498.png!
 # *Repository configuration tab:*
 !image-2019-05-24-12-36-33-732.png!

Bamboo also shows duplicate branches if the branch that is configured in the repository definition was built before:
 # *Branches dropdown button:*
 *!image-2019-05-24-12-43-36-804.png!*
 # *Repository configuration tab:*
 !image-2019-05-24-12-54-31-095.png!

h3. Suggested Solution
 * Bamboo should have an option that will not list the branch that is configured in the Repositories tab.
 * Bamboo shouldn't show duplicate branches in the dropdown button as well.

h3. Workaround

Currently, the workaround is to change the repository definition to another branch that is not the master branch or delete the duplicate one from the branches.
fields.summary: Bamboo dropdown button will always show the branch that is defined in the repository definition

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If remote agent is started in a machine with high CPU/RAM usage, some plugins might fail to startup in remote agent due to "osgi is not running" but remote agent still manage to connect to Bamboo server and pick up Jobs causing it to fail later

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start a remote agent in a machine with high CPU/RAM usage
# Make sure that there is error like the following in the remote agent log:
{noformat}
INFO   | jvm 4    | 2019/05/24 02:20:59 | 2019-05-24 02:20:58,953 ERROR [AgentRunnerThread] [ScanningPluginLoader] Unable to deploy plugin 'com.atlassian.bamboo.warnings.atlassian-bamboo-warnings' from 'Unit: /bamboo-home/plugins/system-provided/atlassian-bamboo-warnings-6.7.1.jar (1541842823000)'.
INFO   | jvm 4    | 2019/05/24 02:21:00 | 2019-05-24 02:21:00,530 ERROR [AgentRunnerThread] [ScanningPluginLoader] Because of the following exception:
INFO   | jvm 4    | 2019/05/24 02:21:00 | java.lang.IllegalStateException: Unable to create a tracker when osgi is not running

{noformat}
# Run a build with this remote agent and the related task in the above error

h3. Expected Results
Remote agent fail to startup and Bamboo will not assign Job to it

h3. Actual Results
Bamboo server assign Job to this remote agent that fail to startup the plugin causing the Job to fail 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Remote agent should fail to startup when osgi is not running

fields.description:
In Bamboo 6.8.0 & 6.8.1, server.xml has an uncommented SSL connector:

{code:title=server.xml}
        <!--
        ====================================================================================
        To run Bamboo via HTTPS:
             * Uncomment the Connector below
             * Execute:
                 %JAVA_HOME%\bin\keytool -genkey -alias tomcat -keyalg RSA (Windows)
                 $JAVA_HOME/bin/keytool -genkey -alias tomcat -keyalg RSA  (Unix)
               with a password value of "changeit" for both the certificate and the keystore itself.
             * Restart and visit https://localhost:8443/

             For more info, see :
              https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Securing+Bamboo+with+Tomcat+using+SSL
              and
              http://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-8.0-doc/ssl-howto.html

            port="8443"

            maxThreads="150" minSpareThreads="25"
            connectionTimeout="20000"
            disableUploadTimeout="true"
            acceptCount="100"

            enableLookups="false"
            maxHttpHeaderSize="8192"

            useBodyEncodingForURI="true"
            URIEncoding="UTF-8"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If Bamboo Specs contains the {{AllOtherPluginConfiguration}} configuration, it will successfully publish for the initial push.  However any subsequent changes to the code, and pushes will not succesfully run the specs.

This happens for plugins which do not have their own specs configurations.

h3. Expected Results

Specs get published, plans/builds are updated according to changed repository stored specs.

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.bamboo.specs.api.exceptions.PropertiesValidationException: Plan import is blocked to prevent deleting plugin configurations on job Label Tag Version silently. If you are confident that you want to delete all plugin configurations, use com.atlassian.bamboo.specs.api.builders.plan.Job.noPluginConfigurations method explicitly.{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Edit specs to create a new plan, and the new plan will reflect the changes.
fields.summary: Bamboo Specs with custom Plugins will fail to publish after the first

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Source Code Checkout task is not working as expected if the SVN Server is available on both http and https behind an Apache proxy.
h3. Environment
 * SVN Server
 * Apache Proxy using the following proxy rules:
{code:xml}
<VirtualHost *:80>
    ServerName svn.someserver.com

    RewriteEngine On
    RewriteCond %{HTTPS} !=on
    RewriteRule ^/?(.*) https://svn.someserver.com/$1 [R=301,L]
</VirtualHost>

<VirtualHost *:443>
    ServerName svn.someserver.com
    SSLEngine On
    SSLCertificateFile /opt/ssl/server.crt
    SSLCertificateKeyFile /opt/ssl/server.key
    SSLProxyEngine on
    <Location />
            ProxyPass http://svn-server:18080/
            ProxyPassReverse http://svn-server:18080/
    </Location>
</VirtualHost>
{code}

h3. Expected Results

The repositories will be cloned respecting the branch path defined at the task configuration.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If one Docker tasks configured with "Use the agent's native credentials" and another with a specific credential, the second Docker task will overwrite the default {{config.json}} file causing the first Docker task to fail with authentication error

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two plans
# The first plan have a Docker task with "Use the agent's native credentials"
# The second plan have a Docker task with username and password, or shared credential
# Run the first plan
It run successfully with the default credential configured in the machine {{config.json}}
# Run the second plan
The second plan run successfully with a different credential
# Run the first plan again

h3. Expected Results
* The first plan will run successfully again
* The second plan should run Docker command with {{--config}} option to store the credential in another file

h3. Actual Results
The first plan fail with authentication error

h3. Notes
The second plan Docker task credential have overwrite the default credential stored in {{~/config.json}} file causing the first plan to use the credential that only works in second plan

h3. Workaround
Avoid using Docker task in second plan. Replace it with Script task to use {{--config}} option
fields.summary: Docker should use different config to store credential

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Modal overlay position for related deployment in Build dashboard not refreshed when switching to different build plan

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Build dashboard
# Click on the related deployment project icon for planA
# Without closing the modal overlay, click on the related deployment  project icon for planB

h3. Expected Results
The first modal overlay will close and the second modal overlay will open

h3. Actual Results
The same modal overlay is used to display the information for planB. Since it is the same modal overlay, its position isn't changed or refreshed

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Modal overlay position for related deployment in Build dashboard not refreshed

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the Deployments UI, Environments often have associated links that point to the latest  Release that was *successfully* deployed to the environment. This includes the "All Deployment Projects", Specific Deployment Project, and "Environment" status pages. (Check "Projects Overview" attachment for an example)

On the Release status page (for a particular release), there is a list of Environments in the Deployment project. If the release was not deployed to an environment, this page shows "Never Deployed" next to that Environment, followed by a "Now at <Release-name>."

The "Now at" message on this page then references the latest Release that was attempted to be deployed to the environment. This is *regardless* if the release was successfully deployed or not. Please see attachment "Now at message."

This behaviour occurs when the deployment to the environment fails and has the status of "not-built." In the case of the screenshot examples, the release that failed to deploy was "release-8."

h3. Suggested Solution
Remove UI inconsistency by changing the "Now at" release to point to the last *successful* release that was deployed to said environment.

h3. Why this is important
This can cause confusion on which release was actually deployed to the environment, when viewing another release status.
fields.summary: Inconsistent Release links for Environments in the UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a group is deleted from an external user repository, the entries from the ACL_ENTRY table will not be deleted.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Integrate Bamboo with Crowd
# Add a new group
# Synchronize the user repository
# Give permission for this group to a plan
# Delete the group from crowd

h3. Expected Results

The entries on the ACL_ENTRY table get deleted since the group does not exist anymore.

h3. Actual Results

The entries on the ACL_ENTRY table will be persisted.



h3. Notes

This can cause problems especially if there is a group with the same name but written differently (uppercased for example) in any other user repository. The permission line will still appear at plan's permissions tab, with none of the boxes selected and it's impossible to delete it from there through the UI.

 !Screen Shot 2019-05-17 at 18.04.54.png!

{noformat}

56492070 30507009            GROUP_PRINCIPAL Bamboo 0         16   true     false         false         
56492066 30507009            GROUP_PRINCIPAL Bamboo 0         64   true     false         false         
56492067 30507009            GROUP_PRINCIPAL Bamboo 0         2    true     false         false         

{noformat}

{noformat}

-------- ------------------- ------------------- ------ -------- ------------------- ------------------- ----------- ---------- ------------ -----------

32014338 bamboo-user         bamboo-user         T      F        2018-09-19 17:30:07 2018-09-19 17:30:07 (null)      GROUP      31948801     (null)      
44269569 bamboo-admin        bamboo-admin        T      F        2019-01-23 20:51:18 2019-01-23 20:51:18 (null)      GROUP      44138497     (null)      
44269570 jira-software-users jira-software-users T      F        2019-01-23 20:51:18 2019-01-23 20:51:18 (null)      GROUP      44138497     (null)      
44269571 jira-administrators jira-administrators T      F        2019-01-23 20:51:18 2019-01-23 20:51:18             GROUP      44138497     (null)

h3. Workaround

# Recreate the group with the *exact same name* in the local user directory
# Delete the permissions from the plan

Change Bamboo to use G1GC garbage collector by default

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, when a containerized task is run as root the task has root directory permissions to the mounted host directory. This poses security concerns, and a solution that doesn't require these volume mounts should be explored.
fields.summary: Remove volume mount requirement for containerized tasks

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a PR is deleted in Bitbucket Server, Bamboo takes no action upon it.
h3. Expected

When a PR is deleted, disable branch plan associated to the PR.
h3. Workaround

If upgrade is not possible use attached jar for Bamboo 6.10.3. Bitbucket Server should be restarted to get fixed functionality from Bamboo. If restart of Bitbucket Server is not possible, recreate AppLink between Bamboo and Bitbucket Server
fields.summary: When a PR is deleted in Bitbucket Server, Bamboo takes no action upon it

fields.description:
{noformat}
# Add the JAVA 9 specific start-up parameters required by Tomcat
JDK_JAVA_OPTIONS="$JDK_JAVA_OPTIONS --add-opens=java.base/java.lang=ALL-UNNAMED"
JDK_JAVA_OPTIONS="$JDK_JAVA_OPTIONS --add-opens=java.base/java.io=ALL-UNNAMED"
JDK_JAVA_OPTIONS="$JDK_JAVA_OPTIONS --add-opens=java.rmi/sun.rmi.transport=ALL-UNNAMED"
export JDK_JAVA_OPTIONS
{noformat}

All java calls get: 
bq. Picked up JDK_JAVA_OPTIONS:  ...

This can also impact the builds of java code.

h3. Expected behaviour
Bamboo does not pass {{JDK_JAVA_OPTIONS}} nor {{JAVA_TOOL_OPTIONS}} inherited from Tomcat to invocations of java-related commands.

h3. Potential impact
Can impact java builds run on the local agents.

h3. Workaround
Edit {{BAMBOO_INSTALL/bin/catalina.sh}} and comment out lines which define {{JDK_JAVA_OPTIONS}}.
fields.summary: JDK_JAVA_OPTIONS from Bamboo's catalina.sh impacting java calls in jobs using java11

fields.description:
As a bamboo user, I would like to be able to select which variables will be exposed as environment variables while running script tasks. 

This is more critical in plans that have multiple repositories linked to it, each repository will create a series of new environment variables. Based on recent tests, a script task can take up to 30% more time to finish if the plan has 60 repositories instead of 1.
fields.summary: Make environment variables exposure optional

fields.description:
I'd like to open up a PR on the official Bamboo-Docker repo ([https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/docker-bamboo-server/src/master/]) to suggest adding the libtcnative-1 to the installation in order to fix the APR / optimal performance issue.

The patch is something like:

{code:bash}
--- original	2019-05-06 16:41:01.232212189 +0200
+++ new	2019-05-06 16:40:45.848134138 +0200
@@ -16,7 +16,7 @@
 
 RUN apt-get update && \
     apt-get upgrade -y && \
-    apt-get install -y curl git bash procps openssl openjdk-8-jdk
+    apt-get install -y curl git bash procps openssl libtcnative-1 openjdk-8-jdk
 #install Maven separately to avoid JDK 10 installation
 RUN apt-get install -y maven
 
@@ -26,7 +26,10 @@
 ARG DOWNLOAD_URL=https://www.atlassian.com/software/bamboo/downloads/binary/atlassian-bamboo-${BAMBOO_VERSION}.tar.gz
 
 RUN mkdir -p ${BAMBOO_SERVER_INSTALL_DIR} && \
-    mkdir -p ${BAMBOO_SERVER_HOME}
+    mkdir -p ${BAMBOO_SERVER_HOME} &&
+    mkdir ${BAMBOO_SERVER_INSTALL_DIR}/lib/native;
+    ln --symbolic "/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libtcnative-1.so" "${BAMBOO_SERVER_INSTALL_DIR}/lib/native/libtcnative-1.so"; \
+
 RUN curl -L --silent ${DOWNLOAD_URL} | tar -xz --strip-components=1 -C "$BAMBOO_SERVER_INSTALL_DIR"
 
 RUN echo "bamboo.home=${BAMBOO_SERVER_HOME}" > $BAMBOO_SERVER_INSTALL_DIR/atlassian-bamboo/WEB-INF/classes/bamboo-init.properties

{code}
fields.summary: Add Native Tomcat library to Docker image

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the user clicks on the button Start Deployment at Manual Deployment page, Bamboo throws an IllegalArgumentException if the Build Results or Releases are still loading.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a deployment project environment.
 # Click on Deploy button.
 # Click on the Start Deployment button.

{quote}The string '__LOADING__' is a placeholder used when options are loading in autocomplete menus, such as in the "Build result" or "Release" drop-down in Deployment Preview page. 
{quote}
h3. Expected Results

Bamboo should do the Manual Deployment without any errors.
h3. Actual Results

Bamboo throws the error below in the atlassian-bamboo.log and an Internal Server error in the UI:
{code:java}
[ExceptionMappingInterceptor] Could not parse key '__LOADING__'
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Could not parse key '__LOADING__'
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.PlanKeys.getPlanKey(PlanKeys.java:245)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.PlanKeys.getPlanResultKey(PlanKeys.java:275)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.deployments.execution.actions.ExecuteManualDeployment.prepare(ExecuteManualDeployment.java:139)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork2.interceptor.PrepareInterceptor.doIntercept(PrepareInterceptor.java:171)
(...){code}
h3. Workaround

You have these options in order to avoid this error:
 * Wait a few minutes, this will allow time for data to reach all the right locations, and for the caches to rotate.
 * Clear Browser cache (or try in Incognito/Private browsing window) – something may have been cached from an earlier call.
fields.summary: IllegalArgumentException when options are still loading in the Manual Deployment page

fields.description:
We have set two Bamboo instances for our DEVOPS teams (yes we have bought two licences :)). I would like to stress that both servers are meant for actual work. We have separate staging instances which are meant for testing plug-in, upgrade procedure, and training. 

 

The first Bamboo server is used for building our applications and deploying them on our DEV and UAT servers, we refer to it as "Build Server". The second Bamboo server is dedicated to the deployments on our PROD servers, we refer to it as "Deploy Server". The two Bamboo servers are linked together.

 

I am creating this ticket because I would like to create a Deploy Project in the "Deploy Server" and link it to a build plan of the "Build Server". This would greatly simplify my work because for the moment, I have to create a dummy build plan in the "Deploy Server" so that I can use Deploy Projects
fields.summary: Share artifacts between two linked Bamboo instances

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Elastic instance scheduler kills elastic agents running builds

h3. Environment
Bamboo with an EC2 account enabled.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a plan with a task. In this example, a script task with the content
{noformat}
sleep 3000
{noformat}
# Enable concurrent build
# Run the plan twice
# Start two elastic agents to run the two builds
# Configure elastic scheduling as described in our [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/scheduling-your-elastic-instances-289277135.html] with cron "0 0/1 * 1/1 * ? *" (every 1 minute) to set active instance exactly "1"

h3. Expected Results
Agent is not shut down since the build is still running.

h3. Actual Results
Agent is shut down. In the logs we see that the scheduler runs and shuts down the agent:
{noformat}
2019-05-03 15:58:00,008 INFO [scheduler_Worker-10] [ElasticFunctionalityFacadeImpl] Adjusting elastic agents with schedule: com.atlassian.bamboo.agent.elastic.schedule.ElasticInstanceScheduleImpl@22d2d777[2031617,0 0/1 * 1/1 * ? *,com.atlassian.bamboo.agent.elastic.server.ElasticImageConfigurationImpl@be651a6b,EQUALS,1,true]
2019-05-03 15:58:00,008 INFO [scheduler_Worker-10] [ElasticFunctionalityFacadeImpl] Attempting to shutdown 1 of 'Ubuntu stock image' elastic instances
2019-05-03 15:58:00,008 INFO [scheduler_Worker-10] [AgentManagerImpl] No deployments running on agent Elastic Agent on i-07e3eaad67f987836
2019-05-03 15:58:00,009 ERROR [scheduler_Worker-10] [AgentManagerImpl] Agent 'Elastic Agent on i-07e3eaad67f987836' went offline while building BAM-TEST-JOB1-27. The results of that build will not be available. 
2019-05-03 15:58:00,009 INFO [scheduler_Worker-10] [DefaultErrorHandler] Recording an error: Agent 'Elastic Agent on i-07e3eaad67f987836' went offline while building BAM-TEST-JOB1-27. The results of that build will not be available.  : BAM-TEST-JOB1
2019-05-03 15:58:00,015 INFO [scheduler_Worker-10] [CurrentlyBuildingContainer] removeCurrentlyBuilding called for [BAM-TEST-JOB1-27]
2019-05-03 15:58:00,020 INFO [scheduler_Worker-10] [PlanStatePersisterImpl] Updating delta states of build following BAM-TEST-JOB1-27
2019-05-03 15:58:00,022 INFO [scheduler_Worker-10] [AgentManagerImpl] Elastic Agent "Elastic Agent on i-07e3eaad67f987836" stopped on instance i-07e3eaad67f987836
2019-05-03 15:58:00,025 INFO [elastic-pool-3-thread-2] [InstanceTerminator] Requesting that EC2 instance i-07e3eaad67f987836 be shut down.
2019-05-03 15:58:00,025 INFO [scheduler_Worker-10] [ElasticFunctionalityFacadeImpl] Requested termination of elastic instance: i-07e3eaad67f987836
{noformat}

h3.Notes
If plan using the following Script task, the elastic agent will not be killed:
{noformat}
echo hello
sleep 30
<repeat the above commands for 100 times>
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
For now there is no workaround available. If you encounter this problem please disable scheduling until a fix is delivered.
fields.summary: Elastic instance scheduler kills elastic agents running builds

fields.description:
Currently a repository trigger can only verify changes in the whole repository. If you are running a [Monorepo|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monorepo], you can easily run into a situation where everything gets built everytime.

Having a path filter on the change detection could improve the usage for Monorepos, specially of plan branches
fields.summary: Include a path filter for repository triggers

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If Bamboo's JMS broker is not configured as ssl:// (e.g. when it's configured as tcp://, nio:// or nio+ssl://) Bamboo will start an additional SSL listener on port (primary broker port + 1, default: 54664). It would be great to have a way to disable this behavior when an additional SSL connector isn't needed.  

h3. Suggested Solution
* System property to disable the additional SSL listener.
 
h3. Workaround 
Convert the primary broker to SSL instead of TCP and Bamboo will only start one listener:
* [Securing your remote agents|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/securing-your-remote-agents-289277197.html]

The additional connector also serves no purpose in a typical Bamboo installation, feel free to firewall it off if you are looking to reduce open ports for security purposes.
fields.summary: Provide a way to disable the additional JMS SSL listener Bamboo automatically launches.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently is not possible to add a label into a deployment environment.
h3. Suggested Solution

Create a mechanism to allow users to insert labels into the deployment environment.
fields.summary: Add labels in deployment environment
REST API method for customizing the scheduled triggers of deployment environments

fields.description:
I use Elastic spot instances heavily with our Bamboo deployment. Generally working great. However, there can be some sharp edges with the current behavior that can lead to builds stuck in the queue. Suggestions:
 # By default, Bamboo should evaluate each permitted subnet in the image configuration, and identify the subnet with the lowest spot price. I attached screenshots demonstrating that a spot request created by Bamboo got hung up on an exceeded bid price, yet other availability zones had capacity at half the cost. Bamboo should not even attempt an availability zone where the current spot price exceeds the bid.
 # If a spot request is unfulfilled for a certain amount of time, Bamboo should automatically try another availability zone.
fields.summary: AWS - Improvements for spot pricing and Elastic instances

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Running a plan that have Command task with Docker Runner will fail with error message "This task can't be executed in Docker. Use different task or run this build in Agent environment."

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Run a plan that have Command task with Docker Runner

It should fail with error message that Command task is not supported

h3. Actual Results
It fail with error following message:
{noformat}
18-Apr-2019 14:06:36 com.atlassian.bamboo.task.TaskException: This task can't be executed in Docker. Use different task or run this build in Agent environment.

{noformat}

h3. Notes
The error message is not clear on why it can't be executed.

h3. Workaround
Use Script task instead of Command task since it is not supported in Docker Runner anymore

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a build plan is in the middle of quiet period, triggering a build manually will cause the build to wait as well

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a plan with quiet period repository
# Create a commit to trigger the plan
No build start due to quiet period
Bamboo log will show "waiting 1 minute to see if there are any more"
# Before the above trigger work (within the 1 minute), trigger a build manually

h3. Expected Results
The manual trigger build will start running immediately without problem

h3. Actual Results
The manual trigger build started but it is not added to Build Queue. From the Build Summary, it has not perform change detection yet

h3. Notes
It does not work with Concurrent Build too

h3. Workaround
Disable quiet period setting in the repository
fields.summary: Manual trigger will stuck waiting if quiet period is enabled

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Since Jenkins version 2.105, the {{config.xml}} files in the {{JENKINS_HOME}} that store Job definition are defined as XML v1.1 and not 1.0.
The Bamboo Jenkins Importer only supports XML 1.0.
h3. Suggested Solution
Upgrade the importer to support XML 1.1
h3. Why this is important
This will help new Bamboo users coming from Jenkins.
h3. Workaround 
You may be able to update the XML version in your {{config.xml}} files, but please try this in a test or clone of the instance so you don't affect the running Jenkins instance.
fields.summary: Update Jenkins Importer to support XML 1.1

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If PR declined and similar PR is created, PR in Bitbucket will shows build results from two different PR branch plans

h3. Environment
Bitbucket Server 6.2.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set Plan Configuration to "Create plan branch" when pull request is created
# Create a PR in Bitbucket Server
A branch plan (e.g. "test") is created automatically in Bamboo
# Decline the PR in Bitbucket Server
The branch plan "test" is disabled in Bamboo
# Create a new PR for the same branch in Bitbucket Server
A new branch plan "test 1" is created in Bamboo
# Check the related build results in the first PR (declined) second PR (new) in Bitbucket Server

h3. Expected Results
* The first decline PR will show the build result from Bamboo branch plan "test"
* The second PR will show the build results from Bamboo branch plan "test 1"

h3. Actual Results
* The first decline PR show the build result from Bamboo branch plan "test" and "test 1"
* The second PR show the build results from Bamboo branch plan "test" and "test 1"

h3. Notes
* PR in Bitbucket server should only shows the build results from its linked PR branch plan in Bamboo
* Related to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-20043

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Pull request in Bitbucket server shows builds results from 2 PR branch plans

h3. Notes
Bitbucket Server repository type sanitizes the input and it cannot be reproduced with this repository type.

h3. Workaround
Find the affected repositories by running the below SQL on your Bamboo database:
{code}
 SELECT B.FULL_KEY As PlanKey, VCS.*
 FROM VCS_LOCATION VCS
    LEFT OUTER JOIN PLAN_VCS_LOCATION PV ON VCS.VCS_LOCATION_ID=PV.VCS_LOCATION_ID
    LEFT OUTER JOIN BUILD B ON PV.PLAN_ID = B.BUILD_ID
 WHERE XML_DEFINITION_DATA LIKE '%repository.git.commandTimeout</string><string></string>%';
{code}
* Note the above SQL finds an empty string value. It's possible that this error can be caused by any non-integer value and not just empty strings. You should use the string reported in the *NumberFormatException* and substitute it inside the {{LIKE}} clause of the SQL statement, between {{<string></string>}}. E.g. {{<string>stringhere</string>}}

Edit the repositories identified in the SQL and change {{>> Advanced options >> Command timeout}} value to be an integer value >> Save.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When we define a new linked repository (globally or in plan level), we get the below error 
_An unexpected error has occurred. The repository selected has incomplete data. Please reload the page and try again_. We will also see 2 *New repository* in the repository list section when we see this error.
 !image-2019-04-15-14-52-54-025.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any random plan and navigate to  *Plan configuration -> Repositories ->  Add repository -> _Select_ Bitbucket server*
# Double click (not a single click) the Bitbucket Server repository icon.
# Select the respective repository.
# Change the branch from the default one
# Hit 'Save repository'

h3. Expected Results
A new repository is created as per the definition.

h3. Actual Results
* We see an error under Repository section. No repositories are listed when we click on the dropdown.
* We also see two *New repository* like the above screenshot.
 
h3. Workaround
When we define a new repository, we should just click on the respective repository type only once.

h3. Suggested solution
Allow only one request to be processed and prevent multiple clicks from triggering multiple requests.
fields.summary: The repository selected has incomplete data. Please reload the page and try again

fields.description: Currently requirements in YAML Specs always match as *exists.*
fields.summary: Enable more matchers in requirements for YAML Specs

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When we use *VCS branching* and *VCS tagging* tasks and upgrade Bamboo to 6.7 and later, the plans having these tasks (renamed to *Repository Branch* and *Repository Tag* will fail with the error {{svn: E155007: 'build-dir/PROJ-PLAN-JOB' is not a working copy}}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Define a Subversion repository in a plan.
 # Create 2 jobs - one with *Source code checkout* task and *Repository tagging* and other job with just *Repository tagging*
 # Run this plan

h3. Expected Results

The plan should introduce 2 tags and both the jobs must get successfully executed/built.
h3. Actual Results

The plan fails with the below exception in the build log file:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.bamboo.task.TaskException: An error occurred while tagging a repository
at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.vcs.task.VcsTagTask.execute(VcsTagTask.java:64)
at com.atlassian.bamboo.task.TaskExecutorImpl.lambda$executeTasks$3(TaskExecutorImpl.java:319)
...
...
at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
error	04-Apr-2019 10:42:03	Caused by: com.atlassian.bamboo.repository.RepositoryException: An error occurred while trying to obtain repository working copy status
at com.atlassian.bamboo.repository.svn.v2.SvnWorkingCopyManager.getWorkingCopyInfo(SvnWorkingCopyManager.java:84)
at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.vcs.task.VcsTagTask.execute(VcsTagTask.java:59)
... 16 more
error	04-Apr-2019 10:42:03	Caused by: org.tmatesoft.svn.core.SVNException: svn: E155007: 'C:\bamboo-agent-home\xml-data\build-dir\PROJ-PLAN-JOB' is not a working copy
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

For build plans introduce a Source code checkout task in every job wherever we have *Repository Tag* or *Repository Branch* is defined.

For deployment plans add a Source code checkout task to every environment, a script task that uses a native SVN client to check out the correct revision used in the build plan in the same directory as the source code task and then the Repository tag task. 
(The reason for the extra script task with a checkout is the fact that the source code checkout task always checks out the latest changes which may differ from the revision that was used in the build plan.)
fields.summary: Repository branch and Repository tag task fails to run

h3. Problem Definition
Currently we can use NFS to mount the Home Directory from a different server, but for bigger instances, they may outgrow their mount and want to move to S3.

h3. Suggested Solution
Investigate adding support for storing Bamboo Home in S3

h3. Why this is important
Some larger organizations grow quickly, upto multiple TB of data.

fields.description:
We have used bamboo with Bitbucket for a few years now and all was good, but since we updated from 6.5 to 6.8, java specs don't build because we apparently need to specify the ssh keypair.

Looking at it further, I see that we actually have to specify a bunch of parameters that bamboo should just be able to retrieve on its own.

What we have:
{code:java}
    public static BitbucketServerRepository linkedRepository(String projectKey,
                                                             String project,
                                                             String repositoryName) {
        return new BitbucketServerRepository()
            .name(String.format("%s/%s", project, repositoryName))
            .repositoryViewer(new BitbucketServerRepositoryViewer())
            .server(new ApplicationLink().name(GIT_APPLICATION_LINK_NAME))
            .projectKey(projectKey)
            .repositorySlug(repositoryName)
            .sshCloneUrl(String.format("%s/%s/%s", GIT_SSH_BASE, projectKey.toLowerCase(), repositoryName))
            .sshPublicKey()
            .sshPrivateKey()
            .changeDetection(new VcsChangeDetection())
            ;
    }
{code}
What should actually be necessary:
{code:java}
    public static BitbucketServerRepository linkedRepository(String projectKey,
                                                             String project,
                                                             String repositoryName) {
        return new BitbucketServerRepository()
            .name(String.format("%s/%s", project, repositoryName))
            .server(new ApplicationLink().name(GIT_APPLICATION_LINK_NAME))
            .projectKey(projectKey)
            .repositorySlug(repositoryName)
            .changeDetection(new VcsChangeDetection())
            ;
    }
{code}
The ssh keypair used to not be required, not sure why we are getting errors now that says it's mandatory since it worked fine and bamboo has all the tools needed to connect to Bitbucket to generate one and stuff. I don't want to have to keep track of ssh key pairs.
{noformat}

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently we have the option to mask password variables with the keyword "password" or "key" in the variable name.

We would like to see similar options for more keywords, such as:
* "date" opening date picker
* "range" allowing a range of values between "to" and "from"
* etc...

h3. Suggested Solution
Extend the current functionality to match on date and range for variables

h3. Why this is important
We have many customers using variables for customized plans or plan metadata. Having a set datatype allows for consistent data input, so that we know a "date" variable will be "DD/MM/YYYY", for example.
fields.summary: Introduce Variable type based on keyword in name

fields.description: When deployment projects are shared among teams it would be alot more efficent if you could add personal filters in the same way as it is implemented in build plans.
fields.summary: Add personal filter to deployment projects in the same way as in build plans

fields.description:
h3. Administrator can't properly stop remote agent
h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)
 * remote agent started by wrapper

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click Stop agent button for online agent

h3. Expected Results
Agent stopped and remains offline. Agent process and wrapper are stopped.
h3. Actual Results
Agent process dies, but wrapper restarts it and agent comes online

h3. Workaround
Revoke authorization for agent and then click Stop button. Agent would be not able to connect.
fields.summary: Admin can't stop remote agent

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Anonymous access is enabled by default for new Bamboo installations

h3. Suggested Solution
Have anonymous access disabled by default.

h3. Why this is important
With the setting enabled, many pages can be accessed without logging in. This could show Bamboo configurations and results to people outside of the organization, potentially creating security issues.
 
h3. Workaround 
An admin can deselect/uncheck "Access" for Anonymous users under Admin > Overview > Global permissions and Deployment projects, as follows:

h4. Site access and Builds
# Navigate to {{Admin >> Overview >> Global permissions}}
# Scroll down to the *Anonymous users* row (Under *Other*)
# Deselect the "Access" checkbox

h4. Deployments
# Navigate to {{Deploy >> All deployment projects}}
# For each Project:
## Click the Edit (pencil) icon next to one of its Environments
## Click the *Project permissions* button
## Scroll down to the *Anonymous users* row (Under *Other*)
## Deselect the "View" checkbox
fields.summary: Have "Anonymous" access disabled by default

h3. Issue Summary
When post-bootstrap upgrade tasks fail the Bamboo UI is still accessible and the failure is unknown unless logging is reviewed. No build plans are accessible as the plan cache is disabled due to the application being in bootstrap limbo.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Reproduce using BAM-20391 steps: Upgrade task 60903 (Populate PLAN_NAME column in BRS table (post-bootstrap)) fails on Microsoft SQL Server
# Install Bamboo 6.8.1 connected to Microsoft SQL Server database
# Create a build plan
# Upgrade to Bamboo 6.9.0

h3. Expected Results
Bamboo UI is inaccessible and post-bootstrap upgrade task errors are shown in the UI.

h3. Actual Results
Bamboo UI is accessible and failure is unknown (aside from some functionality not working depending on which upgrade task fails). 

Since upgrade failed, plan cache is disabled so *no build plans are visible* and the below is logged:

h3. Workaround
# Shutdown Bamboo
# (!) Take a full backup of your Bamboo database and $BAMBOO_HOME directory before proceeding.
# Edit *$BAMBOO_INSTALL/atlassian-bamboo/WEB-INF/classes/upgrades.xml*
# Comment out the upgrade task *60903*. E.g
{code}
<!-- <upgrade build="60903" class="com.atlassian.bamboo.upgrade.tasks.v6_9.UpgradeTask60903AddPlanNameToResults"/>-->
{code}
# Run the below SQL manually on your Bamboo database:
{code}
update BUILDRESULTSUMMARY set PLAN_NAME = (select TITLE from BUILD B where B.FULL_KEY = BUILDRESULTSUMMARY.BUILD_KEY) where PLAN_NAME is null
{code}
# Start Bamboo
fields.summary: Bamboo 6.9 upgrade task 60903 fails on Microsoft SQL Server with Invalid Syntax

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
A deployment started by a scheduler trigger will not be able to download the artifacts if the last plan result is a specs update. The same will not happen if the deployment is manually triggered.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a Bitbucket cloud specs plan that creates an artifact
 # Run a build in this plan
 # Create a deployment pointing to this plan, which will consume the artifact
 # Run a deployment manually to make sure the artifact is consumed
 # Run another build in the plan
 # Edit the specs configuration of the plan
 # Scan specs from the Bamboo repository configuration
 # Configure a scheduled trigger in the deployment for the next minute

h3. Expected Results
  The deployment will run and consume the artifacts from the last build

h3. Actual Results
  The deployment will fail with the following error in the build logs:
  {noformat}
05-Apr-2019 18:45:00  Unable to download artifact Non required shared artifact: [artifact], pattern: [files]{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Scheduled triggered deployment is not able to download artifact after specs update

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
We have the ability to run parametrized builds manually ({{Run > Run Customized}}) but we don't have the same functionality for branch builds or merged pull requests.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add parametrized build functionality to branches and pull requests
 
h3. Workaround 
There is no known workaround at this time.
fields.summary: Parametrized Builds on Branch or Pull Request
Error in documentation for YAML specs for Job Requirements

fields.description: The Rest API only exposes build artifacts after all enabled stages have finished. But the artifacts are de facto already accessible via /browse/ for every job that has finished. It would be good if the API would always be aware of those artifacts and exposes them, even if the status is still "building".
fields.summary: Expose artifacts on API earlier
